Module kivakit.microservice
Package com.telenav.kivakit.microservice

Class MicroserviceCluster<Member>

java.lang.Object
com.telenav.kivakit.core.messaging.broadcasters.Multicaster
com.telenav.kivakit.core.messaging.repeaters.BaseRepeater
com.telenav.kivakit.component.BaseComponent
com.telenav.kivakit.microservice.MicroserviceCluster<Member>
Type Parameters:
Member - The type of member information to store for each cluster member
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.telenav.kivakit.component.Component, com.telenav.kivakit.core.messaging.Broadcaster, com.telenav.kivakit.core.messaging.Listener, com.telenav.kivakit.core.messaging.MessageTransceiver, com.telenav.kivakit.core.messaging.Repeater, com.telenav.kivakit.core.messaging.Transceiver, com.telenav.kivakit.core.registry.RegistryTrait, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.messaging.Receiver, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.messaging.Transmitter, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.naming.Nameable, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.naming.NamedObject
public class MicroserviceCluster<Member> extends com.telenav.kivakit.component.BaseComponent

Manages members of a cluster by storing MicroserviceClusterMember objects with associated user data in an ephemeral, sequential Apache Zookeeper store. As members join and leave the cluster, the subclass is notified and leader elections take place.

Starting Up

To join this cluster, call join(MicroserviceClusterMember), passing in the user-defined data you wish to associate with your MicroserviceClusterMember. A member should call this method to join the cluster in Microservice.onRun().

As Members Join and Leave

When member objects are added to Zookeeper, this indicates that a new member is joining the cluster, and onJoin(MicroserviceClusterMember) will be called. When member objects are removed from Zookeeper, a member is leaving the cluster and onLeave(MicroserviceClusterMember) will be called. The members() method yields the members of this cluster.

Leader Elections

At any given time, this cluster has an elected leader. The leader is determined by the sort order of MicroserviceClusterMembers according to the Comparable interface implementation. The comparison is implemented by comparing the identifiers returned by MicroserviceClusterMember.identifier(). Each identifier is composed of the DNS name of the member and the process identifier of the member (multiple members can run on a single host). For example: 

Jonathan-iMac.local#83874

Membership

  • Method Details

    • join

      public boolean join(MicroserviceClusterMember<Member> member)
      Joins this cluster with the given member data. Keeps trying to join the cluster when disconnected.
      Parameters:
      member - The member data for this cluster member
      Returns:
      True if the member has signed up to join the cluster when Zookeeper connects. If there is no ZookeeperConnection.Settings object (defined in the deployment folder), no attempt will be made to join the cluster and this method will return false.

    • leader

      public MicroserviceClusterMember<Member> leader()
      Returns the leader of this cluster

      Leaves this cluster and removes the associated member data for this cluster node
